data.title: Pizza Time
data.solution:
# Record from the first line the two integers N and K
n, k = [*map(int,input().split())]

# Record into a list the areas of each of the N slices
a = [int(input()) for i in range(n)]

# Here is where the output numbers L and M will be saved
l, m = 0, 0

# Make N list rotations to find the most optimized solution
for i in range(n):
    # Assume that Maks takes the first K slices of this rotation
    _m = sum(a[:k])
    
    # And then Lina would have to take the smallest remaining slice
    _l = min(a[k:])
    
    # The most optimized solution is the one with the
    # highest difference (M - L)
    if _m - _l > m - l:
        l, m = _l, _m
    
    # Rotate the list once to the left and try again
    a = a[1:] + a[:1]

# After N rotations we will have found the most optimized solution
print(l, m)
data.statement:
Lina and Maks are taking slices of pizza from the same circular pizza.

The pizza has [[N]] slices in total. They must each take at least {{one}} slice and at most [[K]] slices, and all of one person's slices must be <<contiguous>> (next to each other). Not all slices have to be the same size.

Lina wants the <<least>> possible amount (area) of pizza, but she must take at least {{one}} slice due to peer pressure.
Maks wants the <<most>> pizza as is possible, but he can only take up to [[K]] <<contiguous>> slices.

Calculate the total area of the slices of pizza that each of Lina and Maks should take.

<<If the minimization of [[L]] and the maximization of [[M]] cannot be done simultaneously, print the solution with the highest difference {{(M - L)}}. It is guaranteed that there only exists one such solution.>>
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int K:int
loop N read A:int
write answer

STATEMENT
Print the total areas of the pizza slices that Lina and Maks should take.

INPUT
N: The amount of total slices.
K: THe maximum amount contiguous of slices either Lina or Maks can take.
A: Area of each slice.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Two space-separated integers [[N]] and [[K]], the amount of total slices, and the maximum amount of contiguous slices either Lina or Maks can take.

<<Next [[N]] Lines:>> One integer [[A_i]] per line, the area of each of the slices of pizza in clockwise order.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Two space-separated integers [[L]] and [[M]], the total areas of the pizza slices that Lina and Maks should take.

[[M]] is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit signed integer.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Lina and Maks are taking slices of pizza from the same circular pizza.

The pizza has N slices in total. They must each take at least one slice and at most K slices, and all of one person's slices must be contiguous (next to each other). Not all slices have to be the same size.

Lina wants the least possible amount (area) of pizza, but she must take at least one slice due to peer pressure.
Maks wants the most pizza as is possible, but he can only take up to K contiguous slices.

Calculate the total area of the slices of pizza that each of Lina and Maks should take.

If the minimization of L and the maximization of M cannot be done simultaneously, print the solution with the highest difference (M - L). It is guaranteed that there only exists one such solution.
Input
Line 1: Two space-separated integers N and K, the amount of total slices, and the maximum amount of contiguous slices either Lina or Maks can take.

Next N Lines: One integer A_i per line, the area of each of the slices of pizza in clockwise order.
Output
Line 1: Two space-separated integers L and M, the total areas of the pizza slices that Lina and Maks should take.

M is guaranteed to fit in a 32-bit signed integer.
Constraints
1 < K < N < 50

0 < A_i < 100 000
Example
Input
7 3
5
10
10
10
5
1
5
Output
1 30
